medical_history.chief_complaint: Diagnosis of breast cancer and need for breast reconstruction after bariatric surgery.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: A 59-year-old woman was diagnosed with right breast ductal carcinoma in situ and underwent reconstruction 6 years later. She presented for laparoscopic gastric banding after experiencing a 'double-bubble' deformity of the reconstructed breast due to significant weight loss. An additional case involved a 45-year-old woman who developed invasive ductal carcinoma 9 months after laparoscopic gastric bypass surgery.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of breast cancer, previous breast reconstruction, and a prior cesarean section in one patient (Case 2).
medical_history.family_history: Strong family history of breast cancer in Case 2.
